amendment.description: Amendment in the nature of a substitute sought to enhance professional education in palliative care; create family support networks and outreach programs; reduce excessive regulatory scrutiny; and carry out the Congressional opposition to physician-assisted suicide.
amendment.purpose: Amt. no. 2 printed in H.Rept. 106-409 to enhance professional education in palliative care and reduce excessive regulatory scrutiny to mitigate the suffering, pain, and desperation that sick and dying people face at the end of their lives and to carry out the Congressional opposition to physican-assisted suicide.

action.text: Amendment (A002) in the nature of a substitute offered by Mrs. Johnson (CT).

vote.text: On agreeing to the Johnson (CT) amendment (A002) Failed by recorded vote: 188 - 239 (Roll no. 543).
